title: Update developer documentation for new architecture
description:
**As a** contributor
**I want** updated developer documentation reflecting service layer architecture
**So that** I understand how to contribute to the new codebase structure

**Context:**
After SDK decoupling work (EPIC-012), the developer documentation needs updates to reflect:
- New service layer architecture
- SDK vs TUI/CLI boundaries
- Testing guidelines for services
- Contribution patterns

This ensures contributors understand the new architecture and follow proper separation of concerns.

**Technical Notes:**
- Update: CONTRIBUTING.md
- Update: docs/development/architecture.md
- Update: docs/development/testing.md
- Create: docs/development/service-layer.md
- Add: Architecture diagrams
- Document: Service boundaries and responsibilities

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** New contributor
**When** Reading CONTRIBUTING.md
**Then** Understands service layer architecture

**Given** Developer adding feature
**When** Consulting architecture docs
**Then** Knows whether code belongs in SDK, TUI, or CLI

**Given** Writing tests
**When** Following testing guidelines
**Then** Knows how to test services vs UI

**Given** Code review
**When** Checking PRs
**Then** Can verify proper layer separation

**Documentation Updates:**

**CONTRIBUTING.md:**
- Architecture overview section
- Link to service layer docs
- Testing requirements (unit tests for services)
- PR checklist (verify layer separation)

**Architecture Documentation:**
- Service layer diagram
- Data flow diagrams
- Module dependency graph
- SDK vs UI boundaries
- Integration patterns

**Testing Guidelines:**
- Service layer testing (mock dependencies)
- TUI testing (integration tests)
- CLI testing patterns
- Test isolation requirements

**Service Layer Guide:**
- When to add code to services
- When to add code to TUI/CLI
- Service extension patterns
- Callback protocols
- Data model patterns

**Implementation Hints:**
- Use Mermaid for architecture diagrams
- Include code examples showing good vs bad patterns
- Document common pitfalls (business logic in UI)
- Link to SDK integration guide from SOUL-258
- Keep diagrams simple and clear
- Add to CI/CD checks (verify no UI imports in SDK)
